revised_title: On the Development and Extinction of Regular Doubly Refracting Structures in Crystalline Lenses
tldr: Sir David Brewster investigates the development and extinction of regular doubly refracting structures in the crystalline lenses of animals after death. He examines various lenses from different animals and observes the succession of structures and their refractive actions. Brewster also discusses the implications of his findings for the cause and cure of cataract.
